intro: Gymnosporia gurueensis, commonly known as the Gurue thornapple, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-colored berry that contains several seeds. Gymnosporia gurueensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
